## **In 2025 PRO ARTS CELEBRATES ITS 50TH ANNIVERSARY!**

## 

Since its inception in 1974, Pro Arts has been an integral part of Oakland's cultural landscape, serving as a beacon of creativity, innovation, and inclusivity. The organization's journey began with the establishment of the Alameda County Neighborhood Arts Program, born from a collective vision to foster artistic expression and community engagement.

Fueled by federal funding through the Comprehensive Employment and Training Act (CETA) program, the Alameda County Neighborhood Arts Program quickly emerged as a hub for artistic activity. It served as an umbrella organization, nurturing a diverse array of ethnic arts groups and alternative art organizations across Alameda County.

Beyond financial support, the program became a vital center for artistic education and community engagement. It provided training to thousands, not only in artistic skills but also in administrative and technical expertise. One of its groundbreaking initiatives was the administration and funding of _East Bay Open Studios_ , a program that set the stage for similar endeavors nationwide.

At the core of the program's mission was a dedication to the development, promotion, and expansion of artistic and cultural activities on diverse levels. Through educational programs and community outreach efforts, the program aimed to cultivate regional audiences and enrich the artistic and cultural life of neighborhoods throughout Alameda County.
